raw_response: {"answer_index": 2, "answer_text": "Fluoxetine", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "This adolescent presents with symptoms consistent with social anxiety disorder (social phobia): persistent fear of social or performance situations, avoidance, and significant distress/impairment. First-line pharmacotherapy for social anxiety disorder in adolescents is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) such as fluoxetine. Clomipramine (a TCA) and phenelzine (an MAOI) are not first-line due to side effect profiles and dietary restrictions. Propranolol is sometimes used for performance-only social anxiety, but not for generalized social anxiety as in this case.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
